nodes.label: Atlas-Code
active_tasks: Building billing REST API v3 endpoint
Writing unit tests for retry logic

nodes.label: Sentinel-Compliance
active_tasks: GDPR audit for EMEA data flows

nodes.label: Acme Corp pricing: $20/seat
nodes.content: VP of Sales Sarah Chen verbally committed to Acme Corp a pricing of $20/seat/month for their enterprise deal during the call on Feb 3. This was based on the standard enterprise tier with volume discount.

nodes.label: Acme Corp automated proposal: $15/seat
nodes.content: Nova-Sales generated and sent an automated proposal to Acme Corp with pricing at $15/seat/month, pulling from the outdated Q3 pricing sheet which had not been updated to reflect the January price increase.

nodes.label: Enterprise pricing increase to $20/seat
nodes.content: Decision made in Jan 2026 pricing review to raise enterprise tier from $15 to $20/seat effective Feb 1. Approved by CFO and VP Sales. Nova-Sales pricing database was not updated.

nodes.label: Acme Corp Enterprise Deal
nodes.content: High-value enterprise deal with Acme Corp. 500-seat deployment. Final negotiation phase. Multiple stakeholders involved across Sales and Finance.

nodes.label: Billing API: use REST v3 architecture
nodes.content: Team decided on Jan 30 to build the billing API using REST v3 with OpenAPI spec. Atlas-Code was tasked with implementation.

nodes.label: Billing API: switch to GraphQL
nodes.content: Emergency decision 3 hours ago: team switches billing API from REST to GraphQL after Priya's analysis showed 40% fewer round trips for the mobile client. Atlas-Code was not notified.

nodes.label: GraphQL reduces mobile round trips by 40%
nodes.content: Performance analysis by Priya Sharma showed that switching from REST to GraphQL for the billing API would reduce mobile client round trips by 40% and cut P95 latency from 800ms to 320ms.

nodes.label: NA Payments retry logic implementation
nodes.content: NA Payments team is building exponential backoff retry logic for failed payment transactions. Using jitter + circuit breaker pattern. Sprint started Feb 3, est. completion Feb 10.

nodes.label: EMEA Billing retry logic implementation
nodes.content: EMEA Billing team independently designing retry mechanism for recurring billing failures. Also using exponential backoff. Sprint started Feb 2, est. completion Feb 9. No coordination with NA.

nodes.label: Payment Retry Logic
nodes.content: Retry mechanism for failed payment/billing transactions. Critical infrastructure shared across regions.

nodes.label: Q4 2025 Market Analysis — Enterprise SaaS TAM
nodes.content: Iris-Research synthesized market data showing enterprise SaaS TAM at $142B with 12% YoY growth. Key finding: mid-market segment growing 18% faster than enterprise. Used for 3 downstream decisions.

nodes.label: Mid-market expansion initiative
nodes.content: Based on Iris-Research market analysis, the board approved a $2.5M mid-market expansion initiative targeting 18% growth segment. Hiring 8 new sales reps.

nodes.label: APAC market entry timeline
nodes.content: Strategy team set APAC market entry for Q2 2026 based on TAM growth projections from Iris-Research analysis. Budget allocated: $800K.

nodes.label: Q1 2026 hiring plan
nodes.content: Finance approved Q1 hiring plan for 12 new positions based on growth projections from market analysis. $1.8M budget impact.

nodes.label: Product launch: March 15, 2026
nodes.content: NA Product team committed to March 15 launch date for v2.0 at the all-hands on Jan 28. Marketing materials already in production. Press embargo set for March 10.

nodes.label: EMEA integration ready: April 1, 2026
nodes.content: EMEA Engineering is working toward April 1 completion for the localization and payment gateway integration required for v2.0 in EU markets. Henrik flagged this timeline in standup but it hasn't propagated to NA Product.

nodes.label: v2.0 Product Launch
nodes.content: Major product launch for Meridian Technologies v2.0 platform. Cross-division coordination required. Marketing, engineering, and ops all have dependencies.

nodes.label: Quarterly pricing review cadence
nodes.content: Established quarterly pricing review process. CFO, VP Sales, and Head of Product meet first Monday of each quarter to review and adjust pricing tiers.

nodes.label: SOC2 Type II certification by Q2
nodes.content: Board mandated SOC2 Type II certification completion by end of Q2 2026. Sentinel-Compliance tasked with evidence collection and audit preparation.

nodes.label: APAC mobile-first strategy
nodes.content: APAC division adopting mobile-first approach for all new features. Web dashboard secondary. Decision driven by 78% mobile usage in target markets.

nodes.label: Unified data platform migration
nodes.content: Engineering approved migration from legacy data warehouse to unified Snowflake + dbt platform. 6-month timeline, $400K budget.

nodes.label: Enterprise churn rate at 2.1% — below target
nodes.content: January churn report shows enterprise segment at 2.1% monthly churn, beating the 2.5% target. Mid-market at 4.3%, above 3.5% target.

nodes.label: Payment gateway P1 incident on Feb 5
nodes.content: Stripe integration experienced 23-minute outage on Feb 5 affecting 1,200 transactions. Root cause: rate limiting. Retry logic would have prevented 80% of failures.

nodes.label: Competitor Zenith raised Series C at $2B valuation
nodes.content: Zenith Technologies closed $150M Series C at $2B valuation, 3x their revenue multiple. Expanding into same mid-market segment Meridian is targeting.

nodes.label: GDPR audit finding: 3 data flows non-compliant
nodes.content: Sentinel-Compliance identified 3 EMEA data flows that do not meet GDPR data residency requirements. Customer PII transiting through US servers before EU processing.

nodes.label: NPS score dropped from 72 to 64 in January
nodes.content: Net Promoter Score for enterprise customers declined 8 points in January. Primary driver: billing disputes and invoice clarity. 40% of detractors cited pricing confusion.

nodes.label: Beta Inc renewal: $500K ARR by Feb 28
nodes.content: Tom Bradley committed to closing the Beta Inc renewal at $500K ARR by end of February. Currently in negotiation phase. Legal review pending.

nodes.label: APAC market soft launch: March 1
nodes.content: APAC Growth team committed to soft launch in Japan and Australia markets by March 1. Depends on localization completion and payment provider integration.

nodes.label: Penetration test completion by Feb 15
nodes.content: Security team committed to completing annual penetration test by Feb 15. External firm Securitas engaged. Three critical findings from last year need re-validation.

nodes.label: Should we unify retry logic across NA and EMEA?
nodes.content: Given both teams are building retry logic independently, should we create a shared library? Trade-off: coordination overhead vs. long-term maintenance cost.

nodes.label: Can we ship v2.0 to NA without EMEA integration?
nodes.content: If EMEA integration won't be ready until April 1, can we do a phased launch: NA on March 15, EMEA on April 1? What are the marketing implications?

nodes.label: What is the real Acme Corp price?
nodes.content: Two conflicting quotes sent to Acme Corp. Need resolution: honor $20/seat (Sarah's verbal) or $15/seat (Nova-Sales automated). Credibility at stake.

nodes.label: Billing Infrastructure
nodes.content: Core billing and payment processing infrastructure. Spans multiple teams and divisions. Critical path for revenue collection.

nodes.label: Compliance & Security
nodes.content: Regulatory compliance, security certifications, and data privacy. Includes SOC2, GDPR, and penetration testing.

nodes.label: Growth Strategy 2026
nodes.content: Company-wide growth strategy for 2026. Includes mid-market expansion, APAC entry, and enterprise upsell.

nodes.label: API response time P95 at 340ms
nodes.content: Platform team's latest monitoring report shows API P95 response time at 340ms, within the 500ms SLA. However, billing endpoints are at 780ms due to legacy REST architecture.

nodes.label: January revenue: $4.2M (+8% MoM)
nodes.content: January 2026 revenue came in at $4.2M, 8% above December. Enterprise segment drove growth. Mid-market flat. APAC pre-revenue.

nodes.label: 3 of 12 open positions filled in Q1
nodes.content: Hiring pipeline for Q1 2026: 12 positions approved, 3 filled so far. Engineering roles filling fastest. Sales hiring lagging — need to revisit recruiter strategy.

nodes.label: Board directive: focus on enterprise, not mid-market
nodes.content: Board of Directors in January meeting emphasized enterprise-first strategy. Cautioned against spreading too thin into mid-market before achieving $10M ARR in enterprise.

nodes.label: 12 vendor contracts reviewed, 2 flagged
nodes.content: Sentinel-Compliance completed review of 12 vendor contracts in batch 12. Two contracts flagged: DataCorp (missing DPA) and CloudSync (auto-renewal clause unfavorable).

nodes.label: Nova-Sales: 23 proposals generated this month
nodes.content: Nova-Sales has generated 23 automated proposals in February so far. 18 used current pricing, 5 used outdated Q3 pricing sheet (including Acme Corp).

nodes.label: EMEA sales headcount: +3 in Q1
nodes.content: Approved 3 new EMEA sales hires to support growing pipeline. Focus on DACH and Nordics regions.

nodes.label: Migrate to Kubernetes by Q3
nodes.content: Infrastructure team approved Kubernetes migration plan. Current ECS setup hitting scaling limits. 3-phase rollout starting with non-critical services.

edges.label: Atlas-Code still using REST v3 spec
Agent not yet notified of switch
Based on potentially stale market data
Based on potentially stale market data
Based on potentially stale market data

Growth team impacted by APAC entry timeline
